In combination with

Default value: “auto”.

The property allows control over a symbol’s orientation. Note that the property values act as a hint, so that a symbol whose language doesn’t support the provided orientation will be laid out in its natural orientation. Example: English point symbol will be rendered horizontally even if array value contains single ‘vertical’ enum value. For symbol with point placement, the order of elements in an array define priority order for the placement of an orientation variant. For symbol with line placement, the default text writing mode is either [‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’] or [‘vertical’, ‘horizontal’], the order doesn’t affect the placement.
Defines the minimum and maximum scaling factors for icon related properties like
Default value: [0.8,2]. Value range: [0.1, 10]
Increase or reduce the saturation of the symbol icon.
Default value: 0. Value range: [-1, 1]
A spherical dome around the map that is always rendered behind all other layers.
Warning: As of v10.6.0,
is the preferred method for atmospheric styling. Sky layer is not supported by the globe projection, and will be phased out in future major release.
Size of the additional area around the text bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.
Default value: 2. Minimum value: 0. The unit of textPadding is in pixels.

If true, the symbols will not cross tile edges to avoid mutual collisions. Recommended in layers that don’t have enough padding in the vector tile to prevent collisions, or if it is a point symbol layer placed after a line symbol layer. When using a client that supports global collision detection, like Mapbox GL JS version 0.42.0 or greater, enabling this property is not needed to prevent clipped labels at tile boundaries.
Default value: false.
The color of the icon’s halo. Icon halos can only be used with
Default value: “rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)”.

Note that the property values act as a hint, so that a symbol whose language doesn’t support the provided orientation will be laid out in its natural orientation. Example: English point symbol will be rendered horizontally even if array value contains single ‘vertical’ enum value. For symbol with point placement, the order of elements in an array define priority order for the placement of an orientation variant. For symbol with line placement, the default text writing mode is either [‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’] or [‘vertical’, ‘horizontal’], the order doesn’t affect the placement.

Default value: 1. Minimum value: 0. The unit of iconSize is in factor of the original icon size.
If true, text will display without their corresponding icons when the icon collides with other symbols and the text does not.
Default value: false.
Transition options for
Part of the icon placed closest to the anchor.
Default value: “center”.
Text justification options.
Default value: “center”.
Transition options for
Controls the transition progress between the image variants of icon-image. Zero means the first variant is used, one is the second, and in between they are blended together.
Default value: 0. Value range: [0, 1]
Transition property for
The opacity at which the text will be drawn in case of being depth occluded. Absent value means full occlusion against terrain only.
Default value: 0. Value range: [0, 1]
Distance that the text’s anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.
Default value: [0,0]. The unit of textTranslate is in pixels.
The opacity at which the icon will be drawn.
Default value: 1. Value range: [0, 1]
Distance that the icon’s anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.
Default value: [0,0]. The unit of iconTranslate is in pixels.
Offset distance of icon from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. Each component is multiplied by the value of
to obtain the final offset in pixels. When combined with
the offset will be as if the rotated direction was up.
Default value: [0,0].
A stroked line.
Part of the text placed closest to the anchor.
Default value: “center”.
Controls the intensity of light emitted on the source features.
Default value: 1. Minimum value: 0. The unit of textEmissiveStrength is in intensity.
Controls the frame of reference for
Default value: “map”.
Transition options for
Size of the additional area around the icon bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.
Default value: 2. Minimum value: 0. The unit of iconPadding is in pixels.

If true, the symbols will not cross tile edges to avoid mutual collisions. Recommended in layers that don’t have enough padding in the vector tile to prevent collisions, or if it is a point symbol layer placed after a line symbol layer. When using a client that supports global collision detection, like Mapbox GL JS version 0.42.0 or greater, enabling this property is not needed to prevent clipped labels at tile boundaries.
Default value: false.

If true, the symbols will not cross tile edges to avoid mutual collisions. Recommended in layers that don’t have enough padding in the vector tile to prevent collisions, or if it is a point symbol layer placed after a line symbol layer. When using a client that supports global collision detection, like Mapbox GL JS version 0.42.0 or greater, enabling this property is not needed to prevent clipped labels at tile boundaries.
Default value: false.
